alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 3:10PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Etowah and southwestern Cherokee Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 310 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Slackland, or near Centre, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hokes Bluff, Centre, Leesburg, Tennala, Ballplay, Slackland, Ball Flat, Western Weiss Lake, Weiss Dam, Wilsonia and Reaves. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
